pr_title: MINOR: Move upgraded docs from site to Kafka docs

timeline.message:
MINOR: Move upgraded docs from site to Kafka docs

A number of doc updates have been applied to the website. For the 2.6.1 release, resync Kafka's docs folder with the website.

timeline.author: bbejeck
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -19,6 +19,6 @@ limitations under the License.
 var context={
     "version": "26",
     "dotVersion": "2.6",
-    "fullDotVersion": "2.6.1",
+    "fullDotVersion": "2.6.0",

timeline.author: bbejeck
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -538,98 +472,74 @@
Safe usage of throttled replication

(2) Ensuring Progress:

If the throttle is set too low, in comparison to the incoming write rate, it is possible for replication to not make progress. This occurs when:

- 
max(BytesInPerSec) > throttle
+ 
max(BytesInPerSec) > throttle

timeline.author: bbejeck
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -538,98 +472,74 @@
Safe usage of throttled replication

(2) Ensuring Progress:

If the throttle is set too low, in comparison to the incoming write rate, it is possible for replication to not make progress. This occurs when:

- 
max(BytesInPerSec) > throttle
+ 
max(BytesInPerSec) > throttle

Where BytesInPerSec is the metric that monitors the write throughput of producers into each broker.

The administrator can monitor whether replication is making progress, during the rebalance, using the metric:

- 
kafka.server:type=FetcherLagMetrics,name=ConsumerLag,clientId=([-.\w]+),topic=([-.\w]+),partition=([0-9]+)
+ 
kafka.server:type=FetcherLagMetrics,name=ConsumerLag,clientId=([-.\w]+),topic=([-.\w]+),partition=([0-9]+)

timeline.author: bbejeck
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1653,9 +1559,9 @@

Streams Mo Use the following configuration option to specify which metrics you want collected: -
metrics.recording.level="info"
+
metrics.recording.level="info"

timeline.author: bbejeck
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -316,28 +294,24 @@
Host Name Verification
harder for a malicious party to obtain certificates with potentially misleading or fraudulent values. It is adviseable to double check signed certificates, whether these contain all requested SAN fields to enable proper hostname verification. The following command can be used to print certificate details to the console, which should be compared with what was originally requested: - 
-                        openssl x509 -in certificate.crt -text -noout
-
+ 
                        openssl x509 -in certificate.crt -text -noout
-

  • Configuring Kafka Brokers

    +

  • Configuring Kafka Brokers

    Kafka Brokers support listening for connections on multiple ports. We need to configure the following property in server.properties, which must have one or more comma-separated values: - 
    listeners
    + 
    listeners

timeline.bodyText: This section should go back in I believe
timeline.author: bbejeck
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -39,17 +81,51 @@
Notable changes in 2 Fetch requests and other requests intended only for the leader or follower return NOT_LEADER_OR_FOLLOWER(6) instead of REPLICA_NOT_AVAILABLE(9) if the broker is not a replica, ensuring that this transient error during reassignments is handled by all clients as a retriable exception. -
  • There are several notable changes to the reassignment tool kafka-reassign-partitions.sh
